intro: Clutia polygonoides, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that contains latex, which can be toxic if ingested. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats. Clutia polygonoides is used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
